p: You'd be swamped with letters if I wrote to you every time I thought of you. It's a joy to hear the happy news of old Nei's progress, and so oftenevery day, I feel the precious, darling bundle of him and see his sweet face. Do on it, we should be near enough to see him every day. This is a wonderful time for you, and we rejoice with you.
We had a little snow yesterday - maybe a half inch. A gleam of sun can fix that.

Surely the world -plat is thickening fast, adn it's not pleasant to think about. I wonder a bit how long it may be until we stand alone on a hostile planet. They should all be exhausted and ready for some sort of working plan before Nei's whikers sprout. That's a comforting thought.
Mellett has written twice lately. Seems in earnest. Maybe they will let me in.
